solution_line_template: If Hank bought {dozens_apples} dozen apples, he spent {dozens_apples}*${price_per_dozen_apples} = $<<{dozens_apples}*{price_per_dozen_apples}={apples_cost}>>{apples_cost}
Hank also spent ${price_per_dozen_pears}*{dozens_pears} = $<<{price_per_dozen_pears}*{dozens_pears}={pears_cost}>>{pears_cost} for {dozens_pears} dozen pears.
The total cost of the fruits that hank bought is ${pears_cost}+${apples_cost} = $<<{pears_cost}+{apples_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
